alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Keokuk; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 07 at 4:57PM CDT until May 07 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Keokuk County in southeastern Iowa... Western Washington County in southeastern Iowa... Southern Iowa County in east central Iowa... * Until 545 PM CDT. * At 457 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Malcom to near Barnes City, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Gibson and Coal Creek around 505 PM CDT. Victor, What Cheer, Victor, Thornburg and Keokuk County Fairgrounds around 510 PM CDT. Delta and Keswick around 515 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Sigourney, South English, Webster, Yenruogis County Park, Lake Iowa Park, Keokuk County Expo, Lake Belva Deer Park, Genoa Bluff, Millersburg, Harper, Lancaster, North English, Parnell, Keota, Kinross, Talleyrand, Holbrook, West Chester and Rubio. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
